item.title: Pavements and road edge full of litter creating surface water accumalation, 18th December
item.description:
The road edge and pavements at this end of Roydene has not been cleaned for a while and there is small litter everywhere. The street sweepers just do the bare minimum. Vans and other worker vehicles constantly throwing rubbish on the pavements and blocking street edges.

item.title: Thames Water are storing equipment illegally, 18th December
item.description:
Despite finishing the road works in Poplar Mount and Parkside Road earlier this year, Thames Water continue to store a vast amount of equipment at the top of Poplar Mount on Parkside Road. This is a constant disruption with endless equipment being brought by van every day to add to the massive amount of materials still there. It appears that work has also finished in the surrounding roads so why should Parkside Road be used as a storage area for Thames Water. It is an eyesore, reduces the parking and there is constant noise and disruption when equipment is dropped off or picked up. I have contacted Thames Water but they are denying that the equipment is theirs despite their signs being all over it. Please could you help as the situation is becoming so frustrating.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Parkside Road, Lower Belvedere, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Furniture fly-tipping, on the first floor of Westlake estate, 18th December
item.description:
Flytipped furniture has been lying around the stairwell/elevator on the first floor for 2-3 weeks now (beneath a newly installed no fly-tipping sign). Cleaning staff don't seem to have reported or moved it so far. Again it is one floor up so may not be visible from ground floor. It is partially restricting access. There was also a tyre left with this waste, but that seems to have been moved elsewhere.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Millender Walk, Rotherhithe, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Rain water/gully/pipework blockage, 18th December
item.description:
Hi, We have an issue with the main road drainage and Thames water passed over to the council claiming it is down to Bromley to sort it. We are located in 69 Park avenue, BR1 4EW(Park avenue care home) and for the past months we have a constant issue with constant flooding of out property (basement area) every time it rains. On the road in front of the property and the side there are road gully's but even the lightest rain transform the are in a big puddle leading to sewage backing up and flooding the basement area. Not sure if there is an issue with the gully's only or the whole road drainage but we get a lot of complaints from pedestrians that are passing on the road pavement in front of the care home and that are splashed with all the mud and dirty water by the cars passing by without reducing the speed when crossing the flooded area. It is also creating a huge discomfort and disruption for the care home as even the lightest rain is making the street sewage to back up into our sewage and the basement area is getting flooded. Is this something the council can arrange to look into as a matter of urgency, please?
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Plaistow Lane, Plaistow, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.description:
